segments.text: Just kind of feel numb, you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.speaker: M

segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I just...I just basically lost someone that was really close to me.
segments.speaker: M

segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've been taking care of it all?
segments.speaker: F

segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, I'm confused.  He was sick or it was an accident?
segments.speaker: F

segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It was kind of like boom... done
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's just really weird because he was really young you know and it kind of like...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: --it just kind of freaks you out.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: So weird you know that like one days it's like you know sounds so stupid but like one day someone's here. And like next day you know they're not here and it just kind of makes you like think about like life and mortality and like that kind of stuff.  You just like used to take for granted--you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Exactly, you know, and like he had so many plans and he was going to do...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It leaves a hole for you too.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It leaves a hole for you too, in your plans together.
segments.speaker: F

segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know, it's like affecting a lot of people it's not just me, you know?
segments.speaker: M

segments.speaker: F

segments.speaker: F

segments.text: like I can't...it's like you know it's like "pinch me" it's like I can't believe like I'm dealing with this, you know.
